com.twilio4j.twiml

Class Redirect<E extends java.lang.Enum<?>>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.twilio4j.twiml.TwiML
      • com.twilio4j.twiml.Redirect<E>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ToXML

    public class Redirect<E extends java.lang.Enum<?>>
extends TwiML
    This class directly reflects the Redirect verb documented at http://www.twilio.com/docs/api/twiml/redirect All of the descriptions included in these javadoc comments come directly from the twilio website.
    Author:
    broc.seib@gentomi.com

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Redirect(E nextState)
      The 'Redirect' verb transfers control of a call to the TwiML at a different URL.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Redirect

        public Redirect(E nextState)
        The 'Redirect' verb transfers control of a call to the TwiML at a different URL. All verbs after 'Redirect' are unreachable and ignored.
        Parameters:
        nextState -

        Converts this object into XML. This function is normally called by the state machine servlet and not called directly by you.

        toXml in class TwiML

      • method

        public Redirect<E> method(Method method)
        The 'method' attribute takes the value 'GET' or 'POST'. This tells Twilio whether to request the 'Redirect' URL via HTTP GET or POST. 'POST' is the default.
        Parameters:
        method - Allowed values: Method.GET, Method.POST. Default value: Method.POST.
        Returns:
        this object so more attributes may be chained.
